news.title: Berger Paints aims at achieving Rs 8,000 crore revenue in FY22
news.para: The city-based company has mostly covered the input cost rise with the price hike of its paints in the last few months, he said, adding that the operating margin for the current year will be anywhere between 16-18 per cent.

news.title: South Delhi civic body's property tax offices to remain open this Saturday, Sunday
news.para: ​The statement said that since a rebate of 15 per cent can be availed only till August 31, 2021, all zonal offices and headquarters of the property tax department of the SDMC will remain open for the taxpayers during this period including Saturday and Sunday.

news.title: Gurugram: South City 1 owners under scanner for extra floors
news.para: The owners, who did not procure the occupation certificates, are under the lens for violation of the Haryana Development and Regulation of Urban Areas Act, 1975.

news.title: DTCP issues notices to 10 builders over slow pace of affordable housing projects
news.para: The projects under the radar are Pyramid Infratech in Sector 86; Aster Infra Homes in Sector 90;Tulsani Developers in Sector 35, Sohna; Arete India Projects in Sector 6, Sohna; Revital Reality in Sectors 79 and 79B and Pivotal Infrastructure in Sector 99.

news.title: Society must step into builder's shoes, complete project: MahaRERA
news.para: The August 21 order further said that on termination, the society becomes the ‘promoter’ and all earlier bona fide liabilities created by the developer would now “squarely rest on the shoulders of the society”.

news.title: SC orders status quo on NGT's demolition order of Godrej Properties' project in Bengaluru
news.para: The direction came on an appeal filed by Godrej Properties and Wonder Projects Development challenging the NGT's July 30 order quashing the EC granted to a high-rise luxury project by them in Bengaluru and directed its immediate demolition.

news.title: Rehabilitation policy for Khori village residents has been finalised: Faridabad civic body
news.para: ​The apex court was told by the counsel appearing for the civic body that they have already demolished nine or 10 farm houses and other unauthorised structures on the forest land in the area.

news.title: U.S. Supreme Court ends CDC's pandemic residential eviction moratorium
news.para: The justices, who in June had left in place a prior ban that expired at the end of July, granted a request by the challengers to lift the moratorium by the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) that was to have run until Oct. 3.

news.title: Government prepares plan to hive off surplus land of PSUs
news.para: In the Budget, finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman had proposed an SPV in the form of a company to monetise non-core assets, which is largely surplus land of ministries, departments and PSUs.

news.title: Telangana government to go slow as land auctions hit legal bump
news.para: Overwhelmed by the response, the government had planned the second phase of auctions in August-end or September in HMDA jurisdiction and even told senior officials to get ready to conduct them.

news.title: Karnataka: Bill for stamp duty cut to be tabled soon
news.para: The Karnataka State Stamps (Amendment) Bill, 2021, is ready and it will be tabled in the legislative assembly and council in the monsoon session that’s scheduled to begin on September 13, according to officials in the parliamentary affairs department.

news.title: e-SHRAM portal to maintain database of 38 crore unorganised sector workers
news.para: Through the portal, the government aims to register 38 crore unorganised sector workers such as construction labourers, migrant workforce, street vendors and domestic workers, among others.

news.title: Morbi: Container shortage, high freight dent ceramic exports
news.para: Ocean freights have jumped two to three times in past few months and tile makers are not getting containers in required numbers to make shipments. This has hit exports from Morbi by 20-40%, said industry players.

news.title: Pune civic body cracks down on illegal constructions
news.para: Illegal constructions on 22,000 sqft area have been razed at Yewalewadi. The civic administration has also planned to extend the drive in the recently merged 23 villages.

news.title: IIT-Madras panel to study stability of buildings
news.para: TNSCB officials said the inspection, which began on Wednesday, is likely to last 45 days before the final report is submitted. The quality of construction is being examined using various devices and the samples will be tested in labs.
